description:
I sequentially create and drop instances.
At the end instance don't start and still stay in state 'networking'.
Note: allocated ips have allocated=false but instance id is not null.
Expected: instance id is null after terminating instance

2011-04-04 19:42:11.0	2011-04-25 18:47:53.0	<null>	false	21	10.0.0.4	1	573	false	false	false
2011-04-04 19:42:11.0	2011-04-25 18:48:41.0	<null>	false	22	10.0.0.5	1	574	false	false	false
title: fixed ips doesn't released

comments.content:
I sequentially create and drop instances.
At the end instance don't start and still stay in state 'networking'.
Note: allocated ips have allocated=false but instance id is not null.
Expected: instance id is null after terminating instance


created_at	updated_at	deleted_at	deleted	id	address	network_id	instance_id	allocated	leased	reserved
2011-04-04 19:42:11.0	2011-04-25 10:45:34.0	<null>	false	20	10.0.0.3	1	460	true	false	false
2011-04-04 19:42:11.0	2011-04-25 18:47:53.0	<null>	false	21	10.0.0.4	1	573	false	false	false
2011-04-04 19:42:11.0	2011-04-25 18:48:41.0	<null>	false	22	10.0.0.5	1	574	false	false	false
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vgalkin

comments.content:
Could you provide some more information on this ? Specifically :

1) More information on how are you creating / dropping instances.
2) whether you wait or not after "dropping" (= deleting ?) an instance.
3) Information on how many fixed-ips are allocated to your projects.

It can take some time for the fixed-ips freed-up by deleting an instance to get back into circulation - so if you are rapidly deleting/re-creating VMs and don't have a large pool of fixed-ips, I'd expect you to hit the issue you are describing.

Do things recover if you wait then try again ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gavin-brebner-orange

comments.content: IPs are not disassociated immediately, see fixed_ip_disassociate_timeout parameter (default is 10min., so it's very likely you run off addresses)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
